    • Method Detail

      • convertToArray

        public static java.lang.Long[] convertToArray(java.lang.String argumentString)
        Method that converts the first argument input from a String to an array of Longs.

      • isLong

        public static boolean isLong(java.lang.String numberToCheck)
        Method checks to see if a number can be parsed as a Long, will return true or false. (To be used in conjuction with args[0])

      • validArgs

        public static boolean validArgs(java.lang.String[] args)
        Method that checks the entirety of the collected arguments, and will tell whether it can be an excepted argument. If not, throws IllegalArgumentException().

      • convertToBaseTen

        public static java.lang.Long convertToBaseTen(java.lang.Long[] toConvert,
                              java.lang.Long firstBase)
        Method will convert the first argument, "toConvert" from its original base, "firstBase" to a base 10 number.

      • countNumberOfDivisions

        public static int countNumberOfDivisions(java.lang.Long copyOfBaseTen,
                         java.lang.Long secondPower)
        Method to count the number of divisons the base 10 number will have until it reaches a number that cant be divided. Resulting number to be used as counter variable.

      • calculateAnswer

        public static java.lang.String calculateAnswer(int counter,
                               java.lang.Long baseTenNum,
                               java.lang.Long secondArgument)
        Method will turn the two arguments into an array of the answer characters, to be made into the actual answer.

      • argLengthChecker

        public static java.lang.Long argLengthChecker(java.lang.String[] arguments)
        Method that checks the inputed third element of args[]. If no aegs[2] found, defaults it to "10".

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Should handle the args values and then output the final math answer.
